DataElement.preferredName: Head and Neck Pharynx Superior Constrictor Muscle Thickness Present Measurement
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the measurement of the thickness of the superior pharyngeal constrictor muscle.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Head and Neck Pharynx Superior Constrictor Muscle Thickness Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the thickness of the superior pharyngeal constrictor muscle.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: For oncology, area of the body generally construed to comprise base of skull and facial bones, sinuses, orbits, salivary glands, oral cavity, oropharynx, larynx, thyroid, facial and neck musculature and lymph nodes draining these areas.

Concepts.definition: For oncology, an area of the body generally construed to comprise the base of skull and facial bones, sinuses, orbits, salivary glands, oral cavity, oropharynx, larynx, thyroid, facial and neck musculature and lymph nodes draining these areas.

Property.preferredName: Pharynx Superior Constrictor Muscle Thickness Present
Property.preferredDefinition: (FAIR-inks) The hollow tube about 5 inches long that starts behind the nose and ends at the top of the trachea (windpipe) and esophagus (the tube that goes to the stomach).:The uppermost of the three constrictor muscles of the pharynx.  It receives nerve supply from the pharyngeal plexus.:The dimension between two surfaces of an object, usually the smallest dimension as opposed to the width or the length: also, viscous consistency.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: A hollow tube that starts posterior to the mouth and nasal cavity and ends superior to the trachea and esophagus.
The uppermost of the three constrictor muscles of the pharynx.  It receives nerve supply from the pharyngeal plexus.
The dimension between two surfaces of an object, usually the smallest dimension as opposed to the width or the length: also, viscous consistency.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: RTOG CRF:Radiation Therapy Oncology Group Case Report Form
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Changed from CTEP to NRG for by script Fri Jan 24 11:30:54 EST 2014

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The measurement of a tumor's diameter.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.

Concepts.definition: Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: Move to caBIG context as teh preferred Rep class for Measurement
